cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northeast, intensify to a hurricane in the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend, then sweep northeast across GA/SC and move offshore near the NC coast before turning east into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood FL to Indian Pass FL; Storm-Surge Watch Chokoloskee FL to Indian Pass FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for portions of the Yucatán Peninsula and Pinar del Rio, Cuba (no warnings yet for U.S. Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then Georgia and the Carolinas (including the southeast North Carolina coast)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (heavy rain spreading into Carolinas Wed–Thu could exceed 4 inches in spots)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (major surge threat confined to FL Gulf Coast; only minor coastal inundation expected for SE NC)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤11% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty 25–40 mph winds possible Thursday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above minor tidal rise; primary surge impacts remain well south of NC
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Wednesday night–Thursday; localized 3–6 inch totals possible with flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands on Thursday
